crossed cheque.translation[0].definition: a cheque in Britain that has two lines across it showing that it must be paid into a bank account
crossed cheque.translation[1].definition: a cheque with two lines across it, and the words ‘account payee’, showing that it can only be paid into a bank account of the person named on the cheque, and not exchanged for cash or paid into a different account
A crossed cheque gives some protection against fraud.
